channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Mattress obstruction, 20th July
item.description:
Obstructing a pavement on Berwick Road opposite number 65

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Berwick Road, East Wickham, London

item.title: Large weeds growing under tree and taking over pavement and upstructing path, 20th July
item.description:
This has been growing for quite a few months and has nearly grown across the width of pavement

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kechill Gardens, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overhanging vegetation, 20th July
item.description:
This has been like it all summer, it also blocks the front entrance to property. It looks like the property may be vacant. It poses a problem as you have to wait to let people pass, then you have to try & avoid it yourself. I reported before but was told as it was on private land nothing could be done. But the over hanging vegetation is all across the public footway, surely the council can do something about this by getting in touch with the property owner
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Lion Road, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Over hanging tree, 20th July
item.description:
Hanging very low making it difficult to pass by and overhanging the property’s front garden

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sandy Ridge, Elmstead, London

item.title: Weeds and overgrown grass, 20th July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lordship Lane, East Dulwich, London

item.title: Rubbish, 20th July
item.description:
I report this every week rubbish, food waste everywhere.i have found the best way to report is ringing the council on 02088548888 asking for waste listing all items that have been dumped/fly tipping. Don't forget to get job reference number.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Floyd Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish bags dumped outside my carpark again, 20th July
item.description:
The residents in the houses on Brunswick court continously dump there rubbish here because of the recycling bins. The run out of room in their own wheelie bins and dump it here instead. When the recycling bins were removed temporarily the bags of rubbish stopped. We have foxes that live in the carpark and surrounding gardens so the bags are always torn open and rubbish everywhere.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Tanner Street, Old Kent Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish, Food waste everywhere., 20th July
item.description:
Every week Top of Floyd Road Charlton by shops over flowing bins , black bags,food waste everywhere,On pavement & in road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 84,82,80,78,76,74,70,66,68,64,62,60,58,56,54,52,50,48,46,44,42,38A, Floyd Road, Charlton, London

item.title: Graffiti on green box on Copers Cope Rd, 20th July
item.description:

item.title: Noise from party in yard, housing and road, 20th July
item.description:
Party and noise from flat, shouting and loud people. Echoed down the street into estate building. Residential area no consideration for others. 2.40 am people leaving shouting and making noise. Shared flat or student let. This is housing NOT a Pub!
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Meeson Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly-tipping on Glenister, 20th July
item.description:
Some of these items in the pictures have been there for over a week and it is growing as the days go by. I’m afraid that if nothing changes we might end up with rodents along with other things that might be harmful for our environment, health and safety.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, Glenister Road, East Greenwich, London
